comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: The above picture may also be viewed here: www.millionmonkeytheater.com/a4dpics/147811.jpg Douglas A4D-2N/A-4C Skyhawk 147811 VA-83 ‘Rampagers’ Modex 301 Tail code AJ of Carrier Air Group Eight (CVG-8) USS FORRESTAL above NAVY on rear fuselage Black painted nose to appear as if radar equipped with a covering radome as was the practice with the A-4C for that period. A4D-2N 147811 Construction Number 12575 was accepted by the US Navy from the Douglas El Segundo California plant on September 29, 1960. Between 1962 and 1967 A4D-2N/A-4C 147811 flew only from Sixth Fleet carriers with four US Navy squadrons in the Atlantic and Mediterranean theaters. 1960-1962; VA-83 ‘Rampagers’ of CVG-8 code AJ aboard CVA-59 USS Forrestal 1962; VA-72 ‘Blue Hawks’ of CVG-7 code AG from CVA-62 USS Independence 1963; VA-172 ‘Blue Bolts’ Detachment 15 of Carrier Anti Submarine Group 58 (CVSG-58) as temporary ‘fighter’ protection aboard anti-submarine carrier CVS-15 USS Randolph. Both 1964 and 1965; VA-172 of CVW-1 code AB from CVA-42 USS Franklin D Roosevelt 1966-1967; VA-66 ‘Waldos’ of Carrier Air Wing Six (CVW-6 code AE) on board CVA-66 USS America. As part of NATO, if a ‘Hot’ war had erupted this aircraft would have been used to attack enemy Soviet forces with nuclear weapons. After November 1962 all US Navy aircraft designations were simplified, with A4D-2N becoming A-4C. VA-66 A-4C 147811 was lost while on a Mediterranean deployment. On Thursday May 25, 1967 Lieutenant Commander A.P. Lowry ejected when his Skyhawk crashed into the sea off the starboard bow of CVA-66 USS America and sank in 1450 fathoms of water. Without injury the very fortunate pilot was saved by the rescue helicopter crew. a4skyhawk.org/3e/va66/va66.htm 1964 picture with A-4C 147811 as background: a4skyhawk.org/content/va-172-4c-buno-147811 A-4C 147811 VA-172 Modex: AB-312 Location: probably NAS Jacksonville, Florida. Date: January 1964 Carrier and squadron skippers, including Captain John Lacouture (Saratoga) and Gerald Miller (Franklin D. Roosevelt) pictured in front of VA-172 A-4C Skyhawk BuNo 147811, AB-312, probably at NAS Jacksonville, FL. Photo courtesy of Bob Lawson. 1964-1965 formation picture with A-4C 147811 included: a4skyhawk.org/content/147811-va-172-us-navy-photograph-bo... A-4C 147811 VA-172 Modex: AB-301 Photo Credit: U.S. Navy photograph from Bob Hinckley flight of four Blue Bolt Skyhawks over the Mediterranean: BuNo 149513, AB-316; BuNo 148586, AB-311; BuNo 147811, AB-301 and BuNo 149564, AB-313. They even painted the Bluebolt insignia on all four aircraft! (All information and images courtesy of the ‘A-4 Skyhawk Association’)
